intro: Robiquetia gautierensis, commonly known as the Gautier's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in coastal regions. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
